definition: quilt/by/(indicates passive-voice clauses)/(literary) to cover/to meet with/(coll.) (since c. 2009) used before a verb that does not accurately represent what actually happened, to describe with black humor how sb or sth was dealt with by the authorities (as in 被自殺|被自杀[bei4 zi4 sha1])
to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Muggers often assault their victims on dark streets.
sentences.chinese: 歹徒时常在黑暗的街道上攻击被害者。

sentences.english: We know nothing except that the victim is an old man.
sentences.chinese: 除了被害者是个老人外，我们对其他一无所知。

sentences.english: The criminal knifed his victim in a rage.
sentences.chinese: 那个罪犯暴怒之下用刀砍了被害者。

sentences.english: The ballistics report indicated that Khalil Musa was hardly a random victim.
sentences.chinese: 弹道报告表明，穆萨并非随机的被害者，他身中九弹。

sentences.english: The murder victim was drilled with bullets.
sentences.chinese: 子弹穿透被害者的身体。

sentences.english: The effects of the cruciatus curse are enough to drive a person to insanity.
sentences.chinese: 这条咒语足以使被害者精神错乱。

sentences.english: Macs have become a victim of their own
sentences.chinese: Macs已成我自己成功后的被害者。
这个凶手勒死了被害者。

sentences.english: The ballistics report indicated that Khalil Musa was hardly a random victim. He had been shot nine times.
sentences.chinese: 弹道报告表明，穆萨并非随机的被害者，他身中九弹。

sentences.english: There is no obvious indicator of how the victims died.
sentences.chinese: 并没有明显的指示这些被害者如何死亡。

definition: to commit a crime or offence
sufferer/a victim of a calamity/a person in distress
